name: Togo - Basic
amount_python_compute: # Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs.  # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result'  result = contract.wage * 0.10
condition_python: # Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs  # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result'  result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

name: Togo - Tax Allowance
amount_python_compute: # Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs.  # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' base = categories.GROSS + categories.CNSS + categories.PROFTAX result = base * -0.15 if base <= 10000000 else base * -0.5

name: Togo â€“ NTS
amount_python_compute: # Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs.  # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result'  result = categories.GROSS + categories.CNSS + categories.PROFTAX + categories.TAXAL + categories.NTS_DED
condition_python: # Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs  # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result'  result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

name: Togo - TCS
amount_python_compute: # Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs.  # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' if categories.NTS <= 900000:     result = 3000 elif categories.NTS <= 4000000:     result = 4500 elif categories.NTS <= 6000000:     result = 6000 elif categories.NTS <= 10000000:     result = 7500 elif categories.NTS <= 15000000:     result = 9000 else:     result = 10500 result = -result
condition_python: # Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs  # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result'  result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

name: Togo - IRPP
amount_python_compute: # Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs.  # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result'  nts = categories.NTS result = 0 if nts > 15000000:     result += 0.35 * (nts - 15000000)     nts = 15000000 if nts > 10000000:     result += 0.3 * (nts - 10000000)     nts = 10000000 if nts > 6000000:     result += 0.25 * (nts - 6000000)     nts = 6000000 if nts > 4000000:     result += 0.15 * (nts - 4000000)     nts = 4000000 if nts > 900000:     result += 0.07 * (nts - 900000) result = -result
condition_python: # Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs  # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result'  result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10
